relationships.evidence_text: Biodynamics come from Rudolph Steiner who a hundred years ago gave what are now known as the agricultural lectures
he was an extraordinarily gifted scholar and also an extraordinarily gifted spiritual leader

we take that in relatively small quantities and mix it into fresh water. And spread it or spray it or sprinkle it around landscapes gardens parks and even fields of agricultural production farms orchards etc.

we're now working to get these practices and these land medicines more widely adopted throughout mainstream conventional agricultural production as more and more of these farmers are choosing to get back to organics.
when we go back in time through the generations all our ancestors back into the earliest known periods of history or even prehistory.
Think of the Egyptian empire, think of the Greeks, think of the Romans food throughout that entire span of time was organic, was always organic.
there was this massive change that occurred because of industrialization, because of the chemical and chemistry revolution that had us basically developing all sorts of different compounds chemicals.
many of the cancers, many of the cognitive struggles that folks encounter, many of the health issues and struggles that folks are encountering are related to the toxins and poisons in our food.
Now it also turns out that healing soil, regenerating and rebuilding soil is one of the key strategies we have to stop and reverse climate change.
we've got some very special potent land medicines that can be applied in all kinds of different contexts, even in our house plants.
we've effectively been waging a chemical warfare on soil and on water and on ourselves, our own health and well being our own bodies as a result of modern chemical based agriculture.

methane is 19 to 23 times more potent than CO2 carbon dioxide as a heat trapping greenhouse gas
we've gone from 280 parts per million to over 400 parts per million carbon loading in the climate since the beginning of the industrial revolution

evidence.target_surface: 1.3 million who died from car accidents

relationships.evidence_text: and more than the 1.6 million who died from diabetes, all combined.
We have been so focused on building wealth that we have let greed get the best of us.
People are suffering, people are dying, and tired ecosystems are collapsing.
We are in the beginning of a mass extinction, and all you can talk about is the money and fairytales of eternal economic growth.
We have the power to save the planet, but we have to make an important decision.
What is more important? Money or survival?
We have the resources to move towards a greener planet.
Businesses are going to have to prioritize helping the earth by cutting down on things like plastic and reducing the amount of pollution they are releasing.
We will have to invest in renewable energy.
We have all the technology and knowledge that we need to reverse this life-threatening problem.

relationships.target: tree planting robots, solar roadways, fusion energy, machines that will draw CO2
relationships.evidence_text: We are even working on new technologies to help, such as tree planting robots, solar roadways, fusion energy, and even machines that will draw CO2 directly from the atmosphere.

evidence.target_surface: tree planting robots, solar roadways, fusion energy, machines that will draw CO2

relationships.evidence_text: If everyone composted, the impact would be equivalent to removing the pollution from 8 million cars.

relationships.target: taking bikes, walking more, eating organic foods
relationships.evidence_text: Additionally, we can focus on reducing our consumption, taking bikes, walking more, and eating organic foods.

evidence.target_surface: taking bikes, walking more, eating organic foods
